voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
Welcome to lesson 40, where we will continue our exploration of buying tickets in Japan. Our focus today remains understanding ticket information as we explore tourist attraction spots in our target language, Japanese.
Let's start with the statement: "I want to buy tickets." In Japanese, this is said as

lang.mstts:prosody: チケットを買いたいです
チケットを買いたいです

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Now, say you want to specify how many tickets you want, let's say two. In Japanese, you would say:

lang.mstts:prosody: チケットを二枚買いたいです
チケットを二枚買いたいです

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Knowing how to ask about the entrance fee will be handy. The way you ask "What is the entrance fee?" in Japanese is,

lang.mstts:prosody: 入場料はいくらですか？
入場料はいくらですか？

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: Next, you may need to ask if the ticket you're buying covers all attractions, you can say:

lang.mstts:prosody: このチケットはすべての展示を含んでいますか？
このチケットはすべての展示を含んでいますか？

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: Lastly, understanding the exact opening and closing times are crucial while visiting tourist spots. So, for asking the opening time you say,

lang.mstts:prosody: 開園時間は何時ですか？
開園時間は何時ですか？

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: To ask for closing time, use the phrase

lang.mstts:prosody: 閉園時間は何時ですか？
閉園時間は何時ですか？

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: This concludes our lesson on buying tickets for tourist spots and understanding ticket information in Japanese. You're now capable of specifying the number of tickets you want, asking about ticket coverage, and querying about opening and closing hours, all in Japanese! Keep practicing what you have learned.
